name: Unlocking User-Centered Cryptography
description: The human-centric nature of cryptographic applications necessitates a deeper dive into qualitative research to understand user motivations, perceptions, and experiences. This talk is for anyone working on a team that is building applications and experiences that involve cryptography. This talk is for you if you are feeling stuck when it comes to user adoption, or problem identification. I will cover the benefits of utilizing qualitative data, how to get started and examples of this approach in practice.
